words.w: In this lesson we learn the following:
1. We have learnt before أَنْتَ (anta) "you" for masculine singular. Now we learn أَنْتِ (anti) "you" for feminine singular, e.g.
The possessive pronoun form of أَنْتِ is كِ, e.g.
2. We have already learnt that the possessive pronoun form of أَنْتَ is كَ (-ka), e.g.
We have already learnt ذَهَبَ "he went", ذَهَبْتُ "I went" and ذَهَبْتَ "you went". Now we can learn ذَهَبَتْ "she went", e.g.
If the subject is mentioned the pronoun "she" has to be dropped, e.g.
In ذَهَبَتْ the last letter تْ has sukun. If a verb like this is followed by اَلْ the sukun is changed to kasrah e.g.
3. We have already learnt الَّذِي "who, which" for masculine singular. Now we learn الَّتِي for feminine singular, e.g.
The girl student who sat in front of the lady teacher is from Germany.
الطَّالِبَةُ الَّتِي جَلَسَتْ أَمَامَ المُدَرِّسَةِ مِنْ أَلْمَانِيَا.
